meanings.definition: A rod-shaped structure in the eye of an invertebrate, sensitive to light.
meanings.sent1: The rhabdoms in the insect's eye help it see in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the rhabdoms to understand how insects perceive light.
meanings.sent3: The rhabdoms in the bug's eye threw a party when they saw the sun.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like rhabdoms, absorbing every detail of the scenery.
meanings.sent5: The rhabdoms danced with joy as the first light of dawn touched them.

meanings.definition: A bundle of rod-shaped cells in the retina of an invertebrate eye.
meanings.sent1: The rhabdoms in the eye work together to capture light.
meanings.sent2: The rhabdoms in the retina help the insect navigate its surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The rhabdoms in the eye had a race to see who could detect light first.
meanings.sent4: Her vision was as sharp as a hawk's, thanks to the rhabdoms in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The rhabdoms whispered secrets of the world to the curious insect.
